alert.note: Alert for Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Randolph, southern Upshur and northeastern Webster Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 422 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holly River State Park, or 17 miles south of Buckhannon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mill Creek, Holly River State Park, Huttonsville, Alexander, Hacker Valley, Eden, Helvetia, Cleveland, Pickens, and Alton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern and northeastern West Virginia.
